abstract: At a global marketing conference, Coca-Cola said it hoped to reach revenues of $200 billion by 2020. And L’Oréal said that by 2020 it wanted sell products to 2.5 billion customers around the world, compared with 1.2 billion in 2010.

lead_paragraph: Two giant advertisers with ambitious goals to grow even larger offered their peers a glimpse of their strategies at a marketing meeting in New York.

headline.main: Coca-Cola and L’Oréal Offer Ambitious Goals for 2020
